answers.feedback_html: Light may or may not be polarized, but that does not affect its wavefront formation, which determines its nonparallel behavior.
Light is reflected, but that is not the reason that the beam spreads out.
Monochromatic light does not spread out due to refraction.
The beam of light spreads out because of diffraction of its wavefronts.

stem_html: A beam of light always spreads out. Why can a beam not be produced with parallel rays to prevent spreading?

answers.content_html: A diffraction grating is a large collection of evenly spaced parallel lines that produces an interference pattern that is similar to but sharper and better dispersed than that of a double slit.
answers.feedback_html: The lines are evenly spaced and parallel to each other.

answers.content_html: A diffraction grating is a large collection of randomly spaced parallel lines that produces an interference pattern that is similar to but less sharp or well-dispersed as that of a double slit.
answers.feedback_html: The lines are not randomly spaced, and the pattern is sharper and better dispersed than that of a double slit.

answers.content_html: A diffraction grating is a large collection of randomly spaced intersecting lines that produces an interference pattern that is similar to but sharper and better dispersed than that of a double slit.
answers.feedback_html: The lines are neither randomly spaced nor intersecting.

answers.content_html: A diffraction grating is a large collection of evenly spaced intersecting lines that produces an interference pattern that is similar to but less sharp or well-dispersed as that of a double slit.
answers.feedback_html: The lines formed are not intersecting, and the pattern is sharper and better dispersed than that of a double slit.

stem_html: Describe a diffraction grating and the interference pattern it produces.

answers.content_html: A double slit produces the sharpest and most distinct bands.
answers.feedback_html: A diffraction grating produces a sharper set of bands than does a double slit.

answers.content_html: A single slit produces the sharpest and most distinct bands.
